result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamoni Decbriea Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jamoni Decbriea Jones in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Jamoni Decbriea Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Court addresses violations. Statements by parties. Court holds colloquy with defendant. Case remains calendared for review hearing on 11-28-2022 at 9:45 am, Branch 17.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 10.20.2022

Defendant Jamoni Decbriea Jones in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Jamoni Decbriea Jones.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court in receipt of a report from JusticePoint. Court addressed the report with parties. Court gives the defendant a verbal admonishment. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
received and filed, DPA Supervision Report

Defendant Jamoni Decbriea Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad appeared by video for Jamoni Decbriea Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a review hearing. Defendant semi-compliant with the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.26.22
Received and Filed. DPA Apology Letter 2 8.3.2022
Received and Filed. DPA Apology Letter 1 8.3.2022
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; No Contact Order
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with J.K. and K. R.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Parties not able to sign plea questionnaire and agreement due to current circumstances. Court accepts verbal agreement from all parties.

Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Jamoni Decbriea Jones in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamoni Decbriea Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties stipulate to amend Criminal Complaint to remove last sentence. 
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5/27/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea form
